nodes.bodyText: Can't ServiceHelper.getSelectedService be used? It has the advantage of not relying on the specific format of the url.

No because selected service isn't always video service. E.g, go to app drawer, select peertube, open a youtube link from an external lihk, and your are playing a youtube video in peertube selected service, and there won't be timestamp even if it should.
Worse, select youtube service (by default when you open the app), open a link except youtube from an external app, there will be timestamp and will break video url
and I know it's not the best solution but it's a quick one waiting for someone to properly work on the extractor side

Ideally we should implement this
#4316 (comment)
we also shouldn't even use URL there client-side, but add an extractor-side API for getting an URL with timestamp.
but it has been three months and no one is willing to work on this, then I'd like to get this PR merged for the next release.
Now I check video service id, instead of www.youtube.com (or selected service id)
Perfect, I just wanted to suggest this 👍
